org.gtc.compiler

Class ClassWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gtc.compiler.ClassWrapper

  • public class ClassWrapper
extends Object
    ClassWrapper is a wrapper around Class

    This class doesn't have neither half of Class methods. Some methods here are bridge methods and others are helper methods.

    If some needed Class method is not currently available, can be accessible through getJavaClass() method.

    The ClassWrapper class carry too the SourceCode object related to the java Class.

    Author:
    Wagner Macedo

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Method getDeclaredMethod(String name, Class<?>... parameterTypes)
      Bridge method to get a specific declared method in the wrapped class In contrary to Class.getDeclaredMethod(String, Class...), this method doesn't throw any exception, instead returns null silently.
      Method[] getDeclaredMethods()
      Bridge method to get all declared methods in the wrapped class
      Method[] getDeclaredPublicMethods()
      Helper method to get all declared public methods in the wrapped class
      Class<?> getJavaClass()
      The actual java class wrapped
      String getName()
      Bridge method to get the full class name
      String getPackageName()
      The wrapped class package name
      String getSimpleName()
      Bridge method to get the wrapped class name
      SourceCode getSourceCode()
      Get the SourceCode object used to compile this class
      Method[] getTestMethods()
      Get all methods in the wrapped class that is elegible to use test methods A test method is a public void method which doesn't need parameters and it name starts with "test".
      Instance newInstance()
      Create an Instance of the wrapped class This method is very different from Class.newInstance(), because uses the Instance object, that is also a wrapper around any instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getJavaClass

        public Class<?> getJavaClass()
        The actual java class wrapped
        Returns:
        the wrapped Class

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Bridge method to get the full class name
        Returns:
        the name of the class or interface represented by the wrapped Class
        See Also:
        Class.getName()

      • getSimpleName

        public String getSimpleName()
        Bridge method to get the wrapped class name
        Returns:
        @return the simple name of the wrapped class
        See Also:
        Class.getSimpleName()

      • getPackageName

        public String getPackageName()
        The wrapped class package name
        Returns:
        the package name associated to the wrapped class

      • getDeclaredMethod

        public Method getDeclaredMethod(String name,
                       Class<?>... parameterTypes)
        Bridge method to get a specific declared method in the wrapped class

        In contrary to Class.getDeclaredMethod(String, Class...), this method doesn't throw any exception, instead returns null silently.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the method
        parameterTypes - the parameter array
        Returns:
        the Method object for the method of the warpped class matching the specified name and parameters
        See Also:
        Class.getDeclaredMethod(String, Class...)

      • getDeclaredMethods

        public Method[] getDeclaredMethods()
        Bridge method to get all declared methods in the wrapped class
        Returns:
        the array of Method objects representing all the declared methods of the wrapped class
        See Also:
        Class.getDeclaredMethods()

      • getDeclaredPublicMethods

        public Method[] getDeclaredPublicMethods()
        Helper method to get all declared public methods in the wrapped class
        Returns:
        the array of Method objects representing all the declared public methods of the wrapped class

      • getTestMethods

        public Method[] getTestMethods()
        Get all methods in the wrapped class that is elegible to use test methods

        A test method is a public void method which doesn't need parameters and it name starts with "test".

        Returns:
        an array of Method objects elegible as test methods.

      • newInstance

        public Instance newInstance()
        Create an Instance of the wrapped class

        This method is very different from Class.newInstance(), because uses the Instance object, that is also a wrapper around any instance.

        Returns:
        an Instance object, that represents a newly allocated instance of the wrapped class

      • getSourceCode

        public SourceCode getSourceCode()
        Get the SourceCode object used to compile this class
        Returns:
        the associated SourceCode object
